id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

ruleset_model_instances.description: References an instance of a ruleset model with a unique ruleset_model_type.
ruleset_model_instances.notes: For rulesets with ruleset model instances (i.e., user, proposed, baseline,..) generated as separate files, only one instance would be defined for each ASHRAE229 RMR json file. For rulesets where the software always produces all ruleset model instances together, multiple ruleset model instances would appear in the same ASHRAE229 RMR json file.

calendar.description: Information on the calendar used with the simulation.

weather.description: Information on the local weather conditions used with the simulation.

compliance_path.description: Indicates the chosen compliance path if the ruleset has multiple compliance paths such as 90.1 Appendix G has code compliance and beyond code

outputs.description: Outputs not related to a specific ruleset model instance.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

ruleset_model_type.description: Describes the current model instance for rulesets with multiple simulation models

transformers.description: Electrical transformers at the building site
transformers.notes: Contains a list of transformers that convert electricity from a higher voltage to one used by the building, exterior lighting, and other services at the site.

buildings.notes: Contains a list of buildings on the site (often just one).

schedules.description: Schedules for internal loads, thermostats, equipment operation and control, and any other need.
schedules.notes: Contains a list of schedules used in model.

measured_infiltration_pressure_differenc.description: Differential pressure difference used during measurement for infiltration values.
measured_infiltration_pressure_differenc.notes: Used as rating conditions for air leakage for a building. The most common values used are 50 Pa or 75 Pa since they correspond to common rating conditions.

is_measured_infiltration_based_on_test.description: Indicates whether the differential pressure difference used during measurement for infiltration values is based on pressure testing of the building.

outputs.description: Outputs from the simulation of the model summed for all buildings in the simulation.

building_rotation_angles.description: A list of angles that building simulations are performed and results are provided.
building_rotation_angles.notes: List of angles that the building has been rotated.

fluid_loops.notes: Contains a list of fluid loops on the site.

service_water_heating_distribution_syste.description: Service water heating systems on the site
service_water_heating_distribution_syste.notes: Contains a list of service water heating distribution systems at the site.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

building_segments.description: Large portions of a building that share a building area type
building_segments.notes: Contains a list of building segments in the building.

elevators.notes: Contains a list of elevators in the building.

exterior_lighting.notes: Contains a list of exterior lighting systems for the building.

refrigeration_components.notes: Contains a list of refrigeration components in the building.

building_open_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing indicating when the building is open
building_open_schedule.notes: One represent when the building is open and zero when closed. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

has_site_shading.description: Indicates whether the site has features that cast shadows on the building

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

number_of_floors_above_grade.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

number_of_floors_below_grade.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

is_all_new.description: Indicates whether the building segment is completely new construction (true) or existing (false).
is_all_new.notes: Projects that include additions should have a building segments that are existing (false) and for the addition (true). Curtain rules such as baseline fenestration area will apply differently to each portion.

zones.notes: Contains a list of zones in the building.

heating_ventilation_air_conditioning_sys.notes: Contains a list of HVAC systems in the building.

area_type_vertical_fenestration.description: Building area classification used for vertical fenestration
area_type_vertical_fenestration.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

area_type_heating_ventilation_air_condit.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used. JG to verify if used in test case description.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group
id.notes: No multipliers or floor multipliers are used with the Zone data group so each zone should be individually identified.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

spaces.notes: Contains a list of spaces in the building.

floor_name.notes: Used to group zones on a floor. Zones with the same floor name are on the same floor. Numbers may be used as part of the floor name such as Level 1. If a number is used it should increase for increasing heights and use negative values for stories generally below ground. The floor name should generally correspond to numbering of floors on the plans. JG to verify if used in test case description.

surfaces.notes: Contains a list of surfaces that define the zone.

infiltration.notes: References a single infiltration data group.

design_thermostat_cooling_setpoint.description: Setpoint temperature for cooling during occupied hours
design_thermostat_cooling_setpoint.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

thermostat_cooling_setpoint_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the cooling setpoint temperatures

design_thermostat_heating_setpoint.description: Setpoint temperature for heating during occupied hours
design_thermostat_heating_setpoint.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

thermostat_heating_setpoint_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the heating setpoint temperatures

terminals.notes: Multiple terminals may be used such as from a VAV system, a DOAS, and a baseboard. JG to verify if used in test case description.

served_by_service_water_heating_system.description: A service water heating system serving the zone
served_by_service_water_heating_system.notes: Contains a single ID of the service water heating system serving the zone - from Unique Identification Number in ServiceWaterHeatingSystem. Constraint to use when implemented :ServiceWaterHeatingDistributionSystem:

transfer_airflow_rate.notes: Net transfer air. Positive values indicate transfer air in to the zone and negative values show transfer out of the zone. JG to verify if used in test case description.

exhaust_airflow_rate.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

makeup_airflow_rate.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

non_mechanical_cooling_fan_power.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

non_mechanical_cooling_fan_airflow.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

air_distribution_effectiveness.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

interior_lighting.description: Internal lighting that produce internal gains for a space.

miscellaneous_equipment.description: Miscellaneous equipment loads that produce internal gains for a space.

floor_area.description: The floor area of the space.
floor_area.notes: The floor area of a space within the building, including basements, mezzanine and intermediate-floored tiers, and penthouses with a headroom height of 7.5 ft or greater. It is measured from the exterior faces of walls or from the center-line of walls separating buildings, but excluding covered walkways, open roofed-over areas, porches and similar spaces, pipe trenches, exterior terraces or steps, chimneys, roof overhangs, and similar features. This is the floor area that is modeled.

number_of_occupants.description: Number of occupants in the space

occupant_multiplier_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the multiplier for the number of occupants

occupant_sensible_heat_gain.description: Sensible heat gain of each occupant.
occupant_sensible_heat_gain.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

space_function.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

lighting_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

ventilations_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_space_type.description: Service water heating space type classification
service_water_heating_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_weater_heating_uses.description: List of service water heating uses

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

modeling_method.description: The software methodology chosen for modeling infiltration

algorithm_name.description: Name of the algorithm used for modeling infiltration in the specific simulation engine.

measured_air_leakage_rate.description: Meaured air leakage rate from infiltration of outside air
measured_air_leakage_rate.notes: Based on the pressure described in ASHRAE229.measured_infiltration_pressure_difference.

infiltration_flow_rate.notes: Infiltration flow rate for simulation infiltration models unadjusted for temperature difference or windspeed or schedule often with a windspeed at 10 mph (4.5 m/s).  This may vary in meaning between simulation engines.

multiplier_schedule.description: Referenced to the schedule containing the multiplier for the infiltration

descriptions: Weather Driven. The amount of air leakage is determined by using the infiltration_flow_rate with a correlation usually involving windspeed, height, and the difference between indoor and outdoor temperature and is then multiplied by the schedule.
Pressure Based. The amount of air leakage is determined by induced airflows from pressure differences between zones, air distribution system components, the outside due to wind speed and direction.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

subsurfaces.description: Suburfaces that are on the surface
subsurfaces.notes: Contains a list of surfaces that define the space.

classification.notes: Options for surface being interior or exterior wall, floor, or ceiling.

area.notes: Measured from interior face area. It is the gross area of the wall and includes the area of all subsurfaces.

tilt.description: Angle between vertical and the surface outward normal
tilt.notes: Example value would be 0 = roof, 90 = wall, 180 = downward facing surface (exterior floor)

azimuth.description: Clockwise angle between North and the horizontal projection of the wall's outward normal.
azimuth.notes: Example values would be 0 = north, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West

adjacent_to.description: Used to classify the conditions on the surface.
adjacent_to.notes: Determines whether the other side of the surface is modeled and if not what assumptions should be used.

adjacent_zone.description: ID of the adjacent zone for interior surface. Only required when adjacent zone is explicity modeled when adjacent_to is set to INTERIOR.

does_cast_shade.description: Determines whether the surface is modeled as casting shade on other exterior surfaces

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

surface_construction_input_option.description: Identifies whether construction is entered layer-by-layer or simplified (R-value)

fraction_framing.description: Fraction of the construction that is framing.
fraction_framing.notes: Fraction of the construction using framing_layers, the remaining portion uses the primary_layers. If blank, assume zero framing.

primary_layers.description: List of names of layer descriptions starting from the outside surface for primary heat path
primary_layers.notes: For constructions with framing and cavity heat transfer paths, use this for the cavity. For constructions with homogeneous layer, use this element only. Air films should not be included in the list of layers.

framing_layers.description: List of names of layer descriptions starting from the outside surface for the framing heat path
framing_layers.notes: For constructions with framing and cavity heat transfer paths, use this for the framing otherwise leave blank. Air films should not be included in the list of layers.

insulation_location.description: The location of the insulation related to the surface

u_factor.notes: Includes interior and exterior air films as specified by the referenced standard.

r_value.description: r-value of the insulation for the surface

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

thickness.description: The thickness of the material layer

thermal_conductivity.description: The thermal conductivity of the material layer
thermal_conductivity.notes: When thermal_conductivity is specified, r_value should not be provided.

density.description: The density of the material layer

specific_heat.description: The specific heat of the material layer

r_value.description: r-value of the insulation for the material layer
r_value.notes: When r_value is specified, thermal_conductivity should not be provided. Typically used for insulation or air gaps.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

absorptance_thermal_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of long wavelength radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_thermal_exterior.notes: May also be called thermal emittance, emittance or emissivity and represents the fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_solar_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of short wavelength radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_solar_exterior.notes: Equals one minus the solar reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_visible_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of visible radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_visible_exterior.notes: Equals one minus the visible reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_thermal_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of long wavelength radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_thermal_interior.notes: May also be called thermal emittance, emittance or emissivity and represents the fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_solar_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of short wavelength radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_solar_interior.notes: Equals one minus the solar reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_visible_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of visible radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_visible_interior.notes: Equals one minus the visible reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

descriptions: Exterior wall or roof which is adjacent to the exterior environment.
Slab-on-grad or below grade surface if adjacent to ground.
Interior surface if adjacent to another space which is explicity modeled.

Surface adjacent to a environment identical to the space. Sometimes this is described as adiabatic surface since no heat is transfered. The space on the other side of the surface is not explicity modeled.
The surface adjacency cannot be determined by the software.
Construction is entered by R-value only.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

classification.description: Classification for the subsurface being window, skylight, door.

is_operable.description: Identifies whether window subsurface can be opened and closed including by pivoting or sliding.
is_operable.notes: This applies to windows and skylights but not to doors.

has_open_sensor.description: Has sensor and reports to building control system when the window or door is open.

framing_type.notes: This applies to windows and skylights but not to doors.

glazed_area.description: Area of subsurface including glass and transparent surfaces

opaque_area.description: Area of subsurface framing for a window or skylight or opaque portion for a door.

u_factor.notes: Includes interior and exterior air films as specified by the referenced standard.

dynamic_glazing_type.description: Type of dynamic glazing for the window subsurface
dynamic_glazing_type.notes: Indicates if the glazed subsurface can change it's performance properties and if it is automatic or not.

solar_heat_gain_coefficient.notes: For dynamic glazing represents the minimum SHGC

maximum_solar_heat_gain_coefficient.description: Maximum Subsurface SHGC for Dynamic Glazing

visible_transmittance.notes: For dynamic glazing represents the maximum visible transmittance

minimum_visible_transmittance.description: Minimum Subsurface VT for Dynamic Glazing

depth_of_overhang.description: Distance from the edge of the overhang to the subsurface.

has_manual_interior_shades.description: Are there manually-operated interior shading such as blinds, curtains or shades

solar_transmittance_multiplier_summer.notes: Often used to account for interior shading such as drapes.

solar_transmittance_multiplier_winter.notes: Often used to account for interior shading such as drapes.

has_automatic_shades.description: Are there automatic interior shading such as blinds, curtains or shades

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

descriptions: Other types of subsurfaces that allow light to pass

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

purpose_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

power_per_area.description: Total power for lights divided by the area of the space.
power_per_area.notes: When computing the power per area use the area of the entire space.

lighting_multiplier_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the multiplier for lighting

occupancy_control_type.description: Indicates the type of occupancy controls

daylighting_control_type.description: Indicates the type of daylighting controls

are_schedules_used_for_modeling_occupanc.description: Indicates that schedule values are used for modeling the impacts of occupancy controls on lighting.

are_schedules_used_for_modeling_daylight.description: Indicates that schedule values are used for modeling the impacts of daylighting controls on lighting.
are_schedules_used_for_modeling_daylight.notes: For simulations that are modeling daylighting by computing the illumance this should be false.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

energy_type.description: Source of energy for the miscelleous equipment in the space

peak_usage.description: Average hourly peak power by miscelleous equipment in the space.

multiplier_schedule.description: Referenced to the schedule containing the multiplier for the miscellenous equipment

sensible_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a sensible load on the space.
sensible_fraction.notes: Sensible plus latent do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

latent_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a latent load on the space.
latent_fraction.notes: Sensible plus latent do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

has_automatic_control.description: Indicates that the receptacles have automatic controls

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

efficiency.notes: Expresses the efficiency of the transformer as a fraction from 0 to 1, where 1 would represent 100% efficiency.

peak_load.description: Annual Peak electric load on the transformer
peak_load.notes: Peak electric load on the transfomer based on an annual simulation with typical weather file.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

purpose.notes: Describe the purpose of the schedule and how it can be used. Not an enumerations. The purpose assigned by BEM tool should match across RMRs. Examples include thermostat, multiplier for lighting, availability for equipment.

hourly_values.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY. Can also use functions like EFLH(), MAX(), MIN() to determine overall characteristics for the list of schedule values.

event_times.description: Event times when the schedule changes
event_times.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT to describe the time of the year in seconds that the schedule changes value.

event_values.description: Event value at corresponding event time.
event_values.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second. Can also use functions like EFLH(), MAX(), MIN() to determine overall characteristics for the list of schedule values.

type.notes: Primarily indicates if the values may be represented by units such as C for temperature or W for power or m3/s for flow rate or are dimensionless multipliers.

prescribed_schedule.description: True if any schedule values have changed from what appears in the schedule library

is_schedule_modified_for_workaround.description: True if any schedule has been modified for a workaround

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

day_of_week_for_january_1.description: Day of the week for January 1

is_leap_year.description: The schedules assume it is a leap year

has_daylight_saving_time.description: The schedules adjust for Daylight Saving Time

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

weather_file_name.description: The file name for the weather file including extension.
weather_file_name.notes: The file name for the annual weather file such as from TMY, TRY, CWEC, CTZ, WYEC or other sources.

data_source_type.description: Data source use for the weather file.

climate_zone.description: The designation of the climate zone where the building is located
climate_zone.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

cooling_design_day_type.description: The frequency of occurance type for cooling design day

heating_design_day_type.description: The frequency of occurance type for heating design day

descriptions: Historic data aggregated to represent typical weather
Specific weather data for time period based on monitoring
Weather data projected to represent future conditions
Cooling design day 0.4% annual cumulative frequency of occurance
Cooling design day 1.0% annual cumulative frequency of occurance
Cooling design day 2.0% annual cumulative frequency of occurance
Heating design day 99.6% annual cumulative frequency of occurance
Heating design day 99.0% annual cumulative frequency of occurance

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

heat_to_zone.notes: When specified, it is the zone the heat from the elevator motor and lighting lighting get added to

is_variable_speed_motor.description: If the elevator uses a variable speed motor drive
is_variable_speed_motor.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

motor_power.description: Elevator average hourly peak motor power
motor_power.notes: The motor power can be provided either together with or, instead of, the detailed elements used to calculate it.

design_elevator_load.description: Elevator load at which to operate

cab_motor_multiplier_schedule.description: Elevator motor operation multiplier schedule name

cab_ventilation_fan_multiplier_schedule.description: Elevator ventilation fan operation mulitplier schedule name

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

fan_systems.notes: One FanSystem for each HeatingVentilationAirConditioningSystem so if a direct outdoor air system is used a second Zone Terminal should be specified with a separate HeatingVentilationAirConditioningSystem. JG to verify if used in test case description.

heating_system.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

cooling_system.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

preheat_system.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

heating_system_type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

energy_source_type.description: Source of energy for the chiller

hot_water_loop.description: Referenced to the hot water fluid loop

oversizing_factor.description: The oversizing factor applied to the peak load that results in the heat capacity. Zero indicates no oversizing.
oversizing_factor.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump. JG to verify if used in test case description.

is_autosized.description: True if the component is automatically sized by the simulation software
is_autosized.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

heating_coil_setpoint.description: Setpoint of the air leaving the heating coil
heating_coil_setpoint.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

full_load_efficiency.description: Full Low Efficiency expressed as a coefficient of performance or thermal efficiency
full_load_efficiency.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump. JG to verify if used in test case description.

part_load_efficiency.description: Efficiency value based on the selected part_load_efficiency_metric
part_load_efficiency.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump. JG to verify if used in test case description.

heatpump_auxilliary_heat_type.description: Heatpump auxilliary heat type used for backup
heatpump_auxilliary_heat_type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

heatpump_auxilliary_heat_high_temperatur.description: Heatpump auxilliary heat high temperature shutoff
heatpump_auxilliary_heat_high_temperatur.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

heatpump_low_temperature_shutoff.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

humidification_type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

cooling_system_type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

total_cool_capacity.notes: Designed total cooling capacity. JG to verify if used in test case description.

oversizing_factor.description: The oversizing factor applied to the peak load that results in the heat capacity. Zero indicates no oversizing.
oversizing_factor.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

is_autosized.description: True if the component is automatically sized by the simulation software
is_autosized.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

chilled_water_loop.description: Referenced to the Chilled water fluid loop

condenser_water_loop.description: Referenced to the Condenser water fluid loop

full_load_efficiency.description: Full Low Efficiency expressed as a coefficient of performance (COP)
full_load_efficiency.notes: Used for direct expansion. JG to verify if used in test case description.

part_load_efficiency.description: Efficiency value based on the selected part_load_efficiency_metric
part_load_efficiency.notes: Used for direct expansion. JG to verify if used in test case description.

dehumidification_type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

cooling_turndown_ratio.notes: Cooling capacity turndown before simultanenous heating and cooling occurs. JG to verify if used in test case description.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

supply_fans.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

return_fans.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

exhaust_fans.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

relief_fans.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

air_economizer.description: Air side economizer related to the fan system

air_energy_recovery.description: Air side energy recovery related to the fan system

is_variable_air_volume.description: If the fan system is variable air volume.
is_variable_air_volume.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

temperature_control.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

operation_during_occupied.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

operation_during_unoccupied.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

fan_control.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

supply_air_temperature_setpoint.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

reset_differential_temperature.description: Supply air temperature reset differential temperature at minimum cooling load
reset_differential_temperature.notes: When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_TO_SPACE_TEMPERATURE this temperate is added to the supply air temperature at minimum cooling load conditions. When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_DIFFERENTIAL_TEMPERATURE this temperate is the temperate below space tempature when no cooling load. JG to verify if used in test case description.

supply_air_temperature_reset_load_fracti.description: Supply air temperature reset load fraction
supply_air_temperature_reset_load_fracti.notes: When temperature_control is a reset option this is the threshold fraction to use below which supply air temperature reset begins and ramps down to zero. JG to verify if used in test case description.

supply_air_temperature_reset_schedule.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

fan_volume_reset_type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

fan_volume_reset_fraction.notes: When fan_volume_reset_type is DESIGN_LOAD_RESET this is the fraction of the design load that corresponds to minimum air flow. When fan_volume_reset_type is OPERATING_CAPACITY_RESET this is the fraction of the instanteous operating capacity that corresponds to minimum air flow. JG to verify if used in test case description.

operating_schedule.notes: Zero when fan is off. JG to verify if used in test case description. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

exhaust_schedule.notes: Zero when fan is off. JG to verify if used in test case description. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

design_airflow.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

specification_method.description: Options for how the fan is specified

design_electric_power.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Simple. JG to verify if used in test case description.

design_pressure_rise.description: Pressure rise through fan at design flow conditions
design_pressure_rise.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed

nameplate_power.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed. JG to verify if used in test case description.

input_power.notes: Power delivered to the fanÂ’s shaft and does not include the mechanical drive losses. Equivalent to fan brake horsepower for inch-pound units. Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed. JG to verify if used in test case description.

total_efficiency.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

motor_efficiency.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

output_validation_points.notes: Airflow is input to each validation point and energy output is the result. A minimum number of four points is recommended.

airflow.notes: No name and id is needed since typically used as one of a series.

notes: Specify the electric power input of fan
Specify the brake horse power, design pressure rise through, total efficiency, motor efficiency

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

type.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

served_by_heating_ventilation_air_condit.notes: Contains ID of the HVAC system serving the terminal - from Unique Identification Number in HeatingVentilationAirConditioningSystem. Constraint to use when implemented :HeatingVentilationAirConditioningSystem:

heat_source.notes: Used for terminal heat including reheat. JG to verify if used in test case description.

heat_from_loop.description: Referenced to the fluid loop used for heat
heat_from_loop.notes: Only used when heat_source is hot water. Used for terminal heat including reheat. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

cool_source.notes: Used for terminal heat including reheat. JG to verify if used in test case description.

cool_from_loop.description: Referenced to the fluid loop used for cool
cool_from_loop.notes: Only used when cool_source is chilled water. Used for terminal cooling including radiant and fan coils. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

fan.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

fan_configuration.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

primary_airflow.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

secondary_airflow.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

supply_temperature_setpoint.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

minimum_airflow.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

minimum_outdoor_airflow.description: Zone terminal minimum outdoor air volume airflow
minimum_outdoor_airflow.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description.

minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_sched.description: Zone terminal minimum outdoor air volume airflow multiplier schedule name
minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_sched.notes: JG to verify if used in test case description. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

heat_capacity.description: Heat capacity for baseboard or radiant system or reheat
heat_capacity.notes: Only includes the heat capacity of the terminal for hot water or electric coil. JG to verify if used in test case description.

cool_capacity.description: Cool capacity for the radiant system or cooling coil
cool_capacity.notes: Only includes the cool capacity of the terminal for chilled water coil for radiant or fan coil. JG to verify if used in test case description.

is_supply_ducted.description: True if the the supply is ducted.

has_demand_control_ventilation.description: True if the zone has demand control ventilation
has_demand_control_ventilation.notes: The zone is either served by an air handler that responds to demand control ventilation signals from that zone or is served by a DOAS that specifically provides air to that zone on demand. JG to verify if used in test case description.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

pump_power_per_flow_rate.description: Total design pump power divided by the loop design flow rate
pump_power_per_flow_rate.notes: This is the pump power per flow rate for the entire pumping system on the current FluidLoop. The power and flow rate should be for the current FluidLoop only and does not include power and flow rate in any child loops.

child_loops.description: Other fluid loops connected to this one as children.
child_loops.notes: Secondary loops should be described as child loops.

is_sized_using_coincident_load.description: True if the loop is sized based on coincident load

minimum_flow_fraction.description: Minimum fraction of full flow allowed

operation.description: Type of operation used by loop

operation_schedule.notes: One represents when the fluid loop is availble to be operating and zero when not available to be operating. Only used when operation equals SCHEDULED. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

temperature_reset_type.description: Type of temperature reset used by loop

Nonstandard part load value efficiency expressed as a coefficient of performance (COP)

chilled_water_supply_temperature.notes: No name and id is needed since used as one of a series. The temperature is leaving the chiller.

condenser_temperature.notes: Outside air dry-bulb temperature for air cooled chillers and condenser water temperature for water cooled chillers. For water cooled chillers, this is the temperature as the water enters the chiller. For air cooled chilers this the temperature of the ambient air.

chilled_water_supply_temperature.notes: No name and id is needed since used as one of a series. The temperature is leaving the chiller.

condenser_temperature.notes: Outside air dry-bulb temperature for air cooled chillers and condenser water temperature for water cooled chillers. For water cooled chillers, this is the temperature as the water enters the chiller. For air cooled chilers this the temperature of the ambient air.

served_by_distribution_system.notes: From CBECC-Res. Constraint to use when implemented :ServiceWaterHeatingDistributionSystem:

type.description: The type of exterior lighting fixture	none

area.description: Area of the exterior functional space.

length.description: Linear length measure for exterior functional space
length.notes: For example, used when expressing street frontage or door width

power.description: Nominal power  of exterior lighting fixtures

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

is_self_contained.notes: If not self-contained, show as false, and indicates that it has remote condenser

sensible_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a sensible load on the space.

heat_gain_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a heat gain to the space.

case_volume.description: volume of a refrigerated case in cubic meters

total_display_area.description: display area of a refrigerated case in square meters

output_descriptor.description: Ruleset specific descriptor of output from simulation program or postprocessed results
output_descriptor.notes: The output required for a ruleset is determined by the list of output descriptors for that ruleset. Units are described at the end of each output descriptor preceeded by an underscore or the term UNITLESS.

data_group_reference.description: Optionsal reference to a data group that is related to the output
data_group_reference.notes: Typically unused for overall results or references zone, fluidloop, or HVAC data group for outputs that are related to those specific components. For example, annual lighting energy consumption for a specific zone would reference the specific zone.

values.description: The actual values of the output corresponding to the output descriptor
values.notes: Typically a single output value is listed but for some descriptors a series out output values may be appropriate. If a list of values is required the term LIST should appear in the output_descriptor

descriptions: Annual electric consumption for the model
Annual natural gas consumption for the model
Annual consumption by other fuels than natural gas for the model
